title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 2657/92 of 13 September 1992 suspending advance fixing of the monetary compensatory amounts applicable in Italy
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 2657/92  of 13 September 1992  suspending advance fixing of the monetary compensatory amounts applicable in Italy
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
recitals:
,
Having regard to the Treaty establishing the European Economic Community,
Having regard to Council Regulation (EEC) No 1677/85 of 11 June 1985 on monetary compensatory amounts in agriculture (1), as last amended by Regulation (EEC) No 2205/90 (2),
Having regard to Commission Regulation (EEC) No 3155/86 of 11 November 1985 providing for the advance fixing of monetary compensatory amounts (3), as last amended by Regulation (EEC) No 3247/89 (4), and in particular Article 11 (2) thereof,
Whereas in view of the monetary situation and the uncertainty reigning on the exchange markets, there is a danger that the continuation of the present system could give rise to speculative operations; whereas the advance fixing of monetary compensatory  amounts applicable in Italy should therefore be suspended,
main_body: Advance fixing of the monetary compensatory amounts applicable in Italy shall be suspended from 14 September 1992.

This Regulation shall enter into force on 14 September 1992.
It shall apply until 16 September 1992. This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 13 September 1992. For the Commission
Henning CHRISTOPHERSEN
Vice-President
(1) OJ No L 164, 24. 6. 1985, p. 6. (2) OJ No L 201, 31. 7. 1990, p. 9. (3) OJ No L 310, 21. 11. 1985, p. 22. (4) OJ No L 314, 28. 10. 1989, p. 51.
